item.title: Server Source Won't Compile
item.dc:creator: @leonardop6 leonardop6
item.description:
@leonardop6 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:526919”][quote author=leonardop6 link=topic=645668.msg4342634#msg4342634 date=1375371012]

What’s the compiler say.

And why aren’t you using JDK??
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javacpl.exe”

If I use JDK it says the path is unspecified.
The compiler says:

“Press any key to continue . . .”

Should I change the path to ProgramFiles (x86) Instead?
[/quote]
You’re joking right? if it only says that line of text that means it compiled…[/quote]

Clearly you didn’t read the thread

Read full topic

item.title: Server Source Won't Compile
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

  1. uninstall ALL java programs you have such as jre6, jre 7 and etc.
  2. install jre AND jdk just so you have them handy
  3. make sure to install the proper bit you are using!

Read full topic

item.title: Server Source Won't Compile
item.dc:creator: @leonardop6 leonardop6
item.description:
@leonardop6 wrote:

[quote=“Drakzie, post:8, topic:526919”]Instead of
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javacpl.exe”
Try
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin\javac.exe”
Before trying it install the newest verison of java and find out if it perhaps is located in Program Files (x86)
If not then just ignore that point.[/quote]

I’m gonna say this again, I don’t have JDK on my comp. I have reinstalled and I still don’t have it. My friend who does have JDK tried compiling it, and it didn’t work for him, either.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Source Won't Compile
item.dc:creator: @DreadScape DreadScape
item.description:
@DreadScape wrote:

Ok, you guys are new im assuming? Just use Eclipse and try making a new compiler. like a said it could be a anti leech the Source maker added in

Read full topic

item.title: Server Source Won't Compile
item.dc:creator: @Drakzie Drakzie
item.description:
@Drakzie wrote:

Instead of
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javacpl.exe”
Try
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin\javac.exe”
Before trying it install the newest verison of JDK and find out if it perhaps is located in Program Files (x86)
If not then just ignore that point.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Source Won't Compile
item.dc:creator: @leonardop6 leonardop6
item.description:
@leonardop6 wrote:

DreadScape:

You should use JDK. and it will compile as long as you have the correct PATH. Now the reason it isnt saving is maybe the server source maker added a Anti-leach type deal. Try using Eclipse and making a new compiler.

As I said, when my friend compiles he uses JDK. My comp. doesn’t have JDK. That is my path.

Read full topic

item.description:
@leonardop6 wrote:

Java-RSPS-Noob:

path unspecific means you don’t have the correct java version added/with the correct bit for computer

My system is a x64 and I’ve tried updating to 7, 25. It says it worked but I’m still on 9. I restarted my computer and everything. This isn’t the problem, although. My friend has update 25 and it doesn’t compile for him, either.

item.title: Server Source Won't Compile
item.dc:creator: @leonardop6 leonardop6
item.description:
@leonardop6 wrote:

I have worked on changing the files in my server’s source. I compile it, and when it lauches, nothing changes. Why?

Here’s What’s in The Compiler…

@echo off
Title Server Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javacpl.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java
pause

Read full topic
